description: The underlying issue in CVE-2023-7024 is a heap buffer overflow that exists within the WebRTC component of the Chromium open source software. This flaw allows for the potential execution of arbitrary code due to improper handling of memory buffers, leading to various exploitation vectors. The affected Microsoft Edge version incorporates the vulnerable Chromium build, highlighting the significance of timely updates to mitigate risk. As the flaw is acknowledged as actively exploitable in the wild, rapid deployment of the patch in version 120.0.2210.91 is critical to address the vulnerability. Users must ensure they are utilizing the latest build of Microsoft Edge to avoid exploitation risks related to this heap buffer overflow.
